meanings.definition: To cause or force someone to undergo a particular experience or endure a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: The students were subjected to a surprise test by their teacher.
meanings.sent2: The workers were subjected to long hours of hard labor.
meanings.sent3: The cat was subjected to wearing a tiny hat for the amusement of its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was subjected to a whirlwind of conflicting emotions.
meanings.sent5: The soldiers were subjected to intense training to prepare for battle.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something liable or vulnerable to something.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the windows open subjected the house to a risk of burglary.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing sunscreen subjected her skin to the harmful effects of the sun.
meanings.sent3: The decision to skip breakfast subjected him to a day of hunger pangs.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was subjected to the pain of rejection.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was subjected to the weight of heavy trucks, causing it to weaken.

meanings.definition: To bring something under the control or authority of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The new law subjected all businesses to stricter regulations.
meanings.sent2: The treaty subjected the country to the rule of the conquerors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy subjected the house to chaos with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were subjected to the influence of the persuasive speaker.
meanings.sent5: The rebellious group was subjected to the power of the oppressive regime.
